posts.cooked: What is the best starting Chassis for a new team

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: The kit chassis is an incredibly well designed and durable piece of machinery. Carefully put together (with locking nuts/loctite) and thoughtful layout of electronics you should be well served. Add some bumpers that are not an afterthought and you are already doing better than a lot of teams with mechanical drivetrain.

link_counts.title: Good bumpers are hard. How do we make them easier?

posts.name: Jack
posts.cooked:
Kitbot, kitbot, kitbot, you should’ve received/should receive one with your kit of parts, otherwise anything from the AM14U family.

Have your own strategy and design discussions but I would keep up to date with what the everybot team is releasing.

Request for the Everybot Team General Forum

posts.custom_user_title: Alum, Volunteer, Mentor, & Dean’s List Finalist

posts.name: MikLast
posts.cooked: Reiterating, the KOP Chassis hands down.

posts.name: coderkevin
posts.cooked: I always recommend kitbot so you can focus on mechanisms! After your team is successful with mechanisms for a few years, then consider alternate drive bases.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

suggested_topics.excerpt: The new radios are required for the 2025 season, and all teams will receive one as part of the kit of parts in January.
